intro: Spicanta acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Spicanta acuminata is known for its milky sap, which can cause skin irritation.
